vqec_error_t init_vqec_tuner_module ( uint32_t  max_tuners  ) 

Initialize the tuner module:

  • records the supplied maximum number of tuners that may be allocated (This value is assumed to be valid.)
  • initializes tuner list

Parameters:
[in] max_tuners Maximum number of tuners to support.
[out] vqec_error_t VQEC_OK upon success, or else reason for failure.

const vqec_ifclient_chan_event_cb_t *  chan_event_cb

Bind a channel to a tuner

Parameters:
[in] id ID of the tuner whose channel is to change
[in] chanid - ID of the channel to bind to the tuner
[in] bp - bind params
[in] chan_event_cb,: chan event cb function
[out] success or error code.

void vqec_tuner_clear_stats ( void   ) 

Clear stats for all tuners

vqec_error_t vqec_tuner_create ( vqec_tunerid_t *  id,
const char *  name 
)

Create a new tuner and store it within the tuner manager.

If no name is specified, the tuner will be allocated a name corresponding to its array position, e.g., "10". If name is specified, it must not be an empty string, and should consist of alphanumeric characters only, excluding spaces; length is truncated to VQEC_MAX_TUNER_NAMESTR_LEN chars (including the trailing ).

[Invariant] Tuner module must have been initialized prior to this call.

Parameters:
[out] id ID of the newly created tuner, or VQEC_TUNERID_INVALID if no tuner was created.
[in] name Name of the created tuner. Note: only up to the first VQEC_MAX_TUNER_NAMESTR_LEN characters of this string are considered.
[out] vqec_error_t VQEC_OK on success, failure code otherwise.

vqec_error_t vqec_tuner_destroy ( vqec_tunerid_t  id  ) 

Delete a tuner given its tuner id, and remove it from the tuner manager.

Parameters:
[in] id Tuner id to delete.
[out] vqec_error_t Returns VQEC_OK if the tuner is found, otherwise returns failure code.

vqec_error_t vqec_tuner_dump ( vqec_tunerid_t  id,
unsigned int  options_flag 
)

Dump the tuner information for debugging.

Parameters:
[in] id identifies tuner to dump.
[in] 32-bit flag specifying cli display options
[out] vqec_error_t Returns VQE_OK or error code upon failure.

vqec_error_t vqec_tuner_get_chan ( vqec_tunerid_t  id,
vqec_chanid_t *  chanid 
)

Returns the current active channel associated with a given tuner ID.

Parameters:
[in] id ifclient ID of the tuner
[out] chanid currently tuned channel, or VQEC_CHANID_INVALID if none
[out] vqec_error_t VQEC_OK upon success or failure code otherwise.

Returns the dataplane tuner ID associated with a given tuner ID.

[in] id ifclient ID of the tuner
Returns:
dataplane ID of the tuner identified by id.

vqec_tunerid_t vqec_tuner_get_first_tuner_id ( void   ) 

Get the first tuner in the tuner list.

Returns:
Id of the first tuner - this is used for iteration, thereofore we don't want to return pointers, since the iteration inherently is not a thread safe operation.

vqec_tunerid_t vqec_tuner_get_id_by_name ( const char *  name  ) 

Retrieve a tuner from a tuner manager by tuner name. NOTE: Only up to the first VQEC_MAX_TUNER_NAMESTR_LEN characters of the string are considered.

Parameters:
[in] name name of the tuner, NOT necessarily valid (e.g. may be NULL, have invalid chars, or may not be NULL-terminated)
[out] vqec_tunerid_t ID of the found tuner, or VQEC_TUNERID_INVALID if not found.

const char* vqec_tuner_get_name ( vqec_tunerid_t  id  ) 

Returns the tuner name associated with the given tuner ID, or NULL if the supplied tuner ID does not exist.

Parameters:
[in] id ifclient ID of the tuner
[out] char * Name of associated tuner

vqec_tunerid_t vqec_tuner_get_next_tuner_id ( const vqec_tunerid_t  cur  ) 

Get the next tuner

Parameters:
[in] tuner id for the "current" tuner. To prevent accidental circular recursion, "cur" must be a tuner id in the valid range.
Returns:
Id of the next tuner.

uint8_t *  buf,
uint32_t *  pat_len,
uint32_t  buf_len 
)

Get the PAT after a rapid channel change has completed

Parameters:

[in] buf Pointer to the buffer in which PAT is copied.
[out] pat_len Actual length of the PAT copied.
[in] buf_len Length of the input content buffer.
[out] success or error code.

uint16_t *  pid,
uint8_t *  buf,
uint32_t *  pmt_len,
uint32_t  buf_len

[out] pid PID for the PMT section.

[out] pmt_len Actual length of the PMT copied.
[in] buf_len Length of the input content buffer.

boolean  cumulative

vqec_error_t vqec_tuner_get_stats_legacy ( vqec_tunerid_t  id,
vqec_ifclient_stats_channel_t *  stats 
)

Retrieve the stats shown for the "show counters <tuner>" command. These stats are a combination of: tuner's channel session: (channel stats since the tuner's channel became active) tuner session (tuner stats since the tuner was last bound to its channel)

Parameters:
[in] id ID of tuner whose stats are requested
[out] stats contains stats for tuner
[out] vqec_error_t VQEC_OK upon success, or error code upon failure

uint8_t vqec_tuner_is_fastfill_enabled ( vqec_tunerid_t  id  ) 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------- Is a fastfill operation enabled for the tuner? Fastfill will be inactive if the application requested no fastfill at bind time, or if the client or server had fastfill disabled via configuration. If called when the tuner is not bound the method will return false.

Parameters:
[in] id Tuner identifier.
[out] uint8_t TRUE for fastfill enabled, FALSE otherwise. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

uint8_t vqec_tuner_is_rcc_enabled ( vqec_tunerid_t  id  ) 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------- Is a RCC operation enabled for the tuner? RCC will be inactive if the application requested no RCC at bind time, or if the client or server had RCC disabled via configuration. If called when the tuner is not bound the method will return FALSE.

Parameters:
[in] id Tuner identifier.
[out] uint8_t TRUE for RCC enabled, FALSE otherwise. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

void vqec_tuner_module_deinit ( void   ) 

De-initialize the tuner module:

  • resets the amount of tuners that can be supported to 0
  • destroys any existing tuners and removes them from the tuner database.

vqec_error_t vqec_tuner_unbind_chan ( vqec_tunerid_t  id  ) 

Unbind a tuner from its currently-bound channel.

Parameters:
[in] id ID of tuner
[out] vqec_error_t Returns VQEC_OK or error code upon failure.
